meanings.definition: A type of lipid consisting of a glycerol molecule bonded to one fatty acid molecule.
meanings.sent1: Monoglycerides are lipids made up of glycerol and one fatty acid.
meanings.sent2: The monoglycerides in the cell membrane help with the structure of cells.
meanings.sent3: The monoglycerides in the recipe decided to stick together and form a perfect bond.
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking was like the monoglycerides, bonding perfectly with the other ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The monoglycerides acted as the glue holding the lipid molecules together.

meanings.definition: A food additive used as an emulsifier in processed foods.
meanings.sent1: The monoglycerides in the ice cream kept the ingredients mixed well.
meanings.sent2: Processed foods often contain monoglycerides to improve texture.
meanings.sent3: The monoglycerides at the food factory loved making sure everything stayed smooth.
meanings.sent4: The monoglycerides worked like a team of tiny chefs, blending all the flavors together.
meanings.sent5: Adding monoglycerides to the mixture made the food silky and creamy.
